title: The Extraordinary Week of Bob Morris, The Consulting Gardener

story.text: Bob Morris, a retired businessman turned consultant and avid gardener, discovers a strange glowing seed in his garden. Intrigued, he plants it, unknowing of its powers.
Overnight, the seed grows into an enormous, radiant tree. Bob learns that the tree has the magical ability to produce fruit that solves any problem for the person who eats it.
Bob decides to use the magic fruits to help his consulting clients. He secretly adds small pieces of the fruit to their meals during meetings and observes the resolution of their toughest challenges.
News of Bob's uncanny success in consulting spreads across town. Skeptics and supporters alike flock to his home, eager to uncover the secret to his miraculous advice.
A local journalist sneaks into Bob's garden and discovers the magical tree. The story hits the news by evening, and Bob's garden is overrun with people wanting the fruits.
Bob decides to hold a town meeting in his garden. He explains the power of the tree and proposes to use it to benefit the entire community rather than for personal gain.
The community comes together to guard the tree and agree on distributing its fruits fairly. Bob feels content knowing that his retirement brings widespread, tangible benefits.

ending: And thus, Bob Morris not only cultivated plants in his garden but also nurtured the growth of his community.
moral: Sometimes, the seeds of change sprout from the most unexpected places.
